Temperatures of outlets to be tested on a monthly basis. Checking the temperature from the hot tapsUsing an accurate thermometer, check the water flow from a chosen hot tap. When doing this for the first time, the tap furthest away from the calorifier/water heater/boiler should be chosen, this is sometimes called a sentinel outlet.Other representative points can then also be checked in a chosen pattern, eventually repeating the pattern so different taps are checked monthly.Here are the main points to note:Hold the thermometer in the hot water flow for one minuteRecord the temperature on the thermometerIt should be a minimum of 50 degrees Celsius after one minuteIf it is below this, advise whoever oversees the site so the necessary actions can be taken to remedy the issueIf thermostatic mixing valves (TMVs) are fitted, these ensure the temperature never exceeds 44 degrees Celsius primarily to prevent hot water scalding. In this case, the hot water inlet to the TMV should be checked instead of the hot taps. Again, a minimum of 50 degrees Celsius should be recorded in this instance.With a TMV fitted water temperatures at the hot tap should not exceed 44 degrees Celsius.Checking the temperature from water heaters (calorifiers)On a monthly basis check the water flow and return temperatures at water heaters (calorifiers). One way of measuring these temperatures is to use a surface temperature probe. The outgoing water should be at least 60 °C in order to kill Legionella bacteria.Temperatures from cold tapsA similar pattern should be followed to that described for hot water above. Formulate a pattern for rotating through different cold taps each month:Hold the thermometer in the cold water flow for two minutesRecord the temperature after two minutesIt should be a maximum of 20 degrees Celsius or belowReport and action as above if it goes above thisOther water checks to makeMake a monthly check of water temperatures of the flow and return from and to the calorifier (see above).Keeping accurate records is of paramount importance.Asset ID 4600 - Asset Type Water Outlet - Service Level Monthly - Service Due Date 27/10/2025Asset ID 4603 - Asset Type Water Outlet - Service Level Monthly - Service Due Date 27/10/2025Asset ID 4607 - Asset Type Water Outlet - Service Level Monthly - Service Due Date 27/10/2025Asset ID 4608 - Asset Type Water Outlet - Service Level Monthly - Service Due Date 27/10/2025Asset ID 4611 - Asset Type Water Outlet - Service Level Monthly - Service Due Date 27/10/2025Asset ID 4612 - Asset Type Water Outlet - Service Level Monthly - Service Due Date 27/10/2025Asset ID 4616 - Asset Type Water Outlet - Service Level Monthly - Service Due Date 27/10/2025Asset ID 4617 - Asset Type Water Outlet - Service Level Monthly - Service Due Date 27/10/2025Asset ID 4621 - Asset Type Water Outlet - Service Level Monthly - Service Due Date 27/10/2025

data.siteName: Flat 2 Carding Place Eton Berkshire SL4 6BG
data.descriptionText: Luke Trevatt (13/10/2025) - Work NoteAttended site and carried out a full validation test and inspection of the heat rae sadia electro max emersion heating system, system presure topped up to 1.5 Barr manufacturers recommended presure, then fully vented, the cold water suply expansion vessel was tested and pressurised to 1.75 Barr, when system was fully run tested it is expected that cylinder should in crease presure to approx 2/2.6 Barr guage. It has been found that the cylinder side PRV is faulty as this is rated at 3 Barr and when system achieves 2.5 Barr guage starts to let by system water presure, this stops at around 1 Barr and when system cools equates to 0.5 Barr, have advised client on remedial required and will look to source suitable 1/2 inch replacement, I would also sujest a new filling loop valve as this has a small weep on when in use. Will return to site when parts are avaliable from BSS SLOUGH

Temperatures of outlets to be tested on a monthly basis. Checking the temperature from the hot tapsUsing an accurate thermometer, check the water flow from a chosen hot tap. When doing this for the first time, the tap furthest away from the calorifier/water heater/boiler should be chosen, this is sometimes called a sentinel outlet.Other representative points can then also be checked in a chosen pattern, eventually repeating the pattern so different taps are checked monthly.Here are the main points to note:Hold the thermometer in the hot water flow for one minuteRecord the temperature on the thermometerIt should be a minimum of 50 degrees Celsius after one minuteIf it is below this, advise whoever oversees the site so the necessary actions can be taken to remedy the issueIf thermostatic mixing valves (TMVs) are fitted, these ensure the temperature never exceeds 44 degrees Celsius primarily to prevent hot water scalding. In this case, the hot water inlet to the TMV should be checked instead of the hot taps. Again, a minimum of 50 degrees Celsius should be recorded in this instance.With a TMV fitted water temperatures at the hot tap should not exceed 44 degrees Celsius.Checking the temperature from water heaters (calorifiers)On a monthly basis check the water flow and return temperatures at water heaters (calorifiers). One way of measuring these temperatures is to use a surface temperature probe. The outgoing water should be at least 60 °C in order to kill Legionella bacteria.Temperatures from cold tapsA similar pattern should be followed to that described for hot water above. Formulate a pattern for rotating through different cold taps each month:Hold the thermometer in the cold water flow for two minutesRecord the temperature after two minutesIt should be a maximum of 20 degrees Celsius or belowReport and action as above if it goes above thisOther water checks to makeMake a monthly check of water temperatures of the flow and return from and to the calorifier (see above).Keeping accurate records is of paramount importance.Asset ID 5058 - Asset Type Water Outlet - Service Level Monthly - Service Due Date 30/10/2025Asset ID 5060 - Asset Type Water Outlet - Service Level Monthly - Service Due Date 30/10/2025Asset ID 5063 - Asset Type Water Outlet - Service Level Monthly - Service Due Date 30/10/2025Asset ID 5066 - Asset Type Water Outlet - Service Level Monthly - Service Due Date 30/10/2025Asset ID 5069 - Asset Type Water Outlet - Service Level Monthly - Service Due Date 30/10/2025Asset ID 5071 - Asset Type Water Outlet - Service Level Monthly - Service Due Date 30/10/2025Asset ID 5074 - Asset Type Water Outlet - Service Level Monthly - Service Due Date 30/10/2025Asset ID 5076 - Asset Type Water Outlet - Service Level Monthly - Service Due Date 30/10/2025Asset ID 5078 - Asset Type Water Outlet - Service Level Monthly - Service Due Date 30/10/2025Asset ID 5081 - Asset Type Water Outlet - Service Level Monthly - Service Due Date 30/10/2025Asset ID 5084 - Asset Type Water Outlet - Service Level Monthly - Service Due Date 30/10/2025

data.descriptionText: MEL have attended site to carry out the investigations on the reported noisy heating pumps.

Faulty damaged tap/sink. Luke Trevatt (24/09/2025) - Work NoteAfter inspection I would advise that the sink basin, mixer tap require replacement and local isolation be fitted to hot and cold water services, also worktop cupboard and carcass are very old and greatly in need of upgrade/replacement, question would be to what extent can job be carried out... Have spoken with Paul Maisey, he is going to email master at Holland, with possible scope of work and costing.

Boiler faultLuke Trevatt (24/09/2025) - Work NoteAfter attending site and carrying out the reset of gas, due to fire alarm activation by accident by one of the Athens staff, all boilers and building ventilation systems were re activated.It was found that boiler 2 CONTROL panel screen was blank, this after electrically isolating, was found to have large amounts of moisture /water internally also the main pcb CONTROL board and all plastic enclosure were extremely wet for sweating. I completed full drying of all electrical connection and pcb controls boards and enclosure. Tested integrity and then replaced fast blow internal fuse, the boiler is now fully operational and controls are working correctly, I would however recommend these controls module get raised at least 100mm off the surface of boiler to prevent this happening and reduce risk of complete failure of PCB controls.
No heatingCasey Bonner (23/09/2025) - Work NoteRepressurise heating systemvent release seized trv’s and lock shields

Many TRV VALVES Faulty or broken within property, Luke Trevatt (03/10/2025) - Work NoteAttended 2 broadbent house and tested all accessible TRV radiator valves I changed 3x broken valve heads as these were snapped off, there were 2x radiators on site completely restricted by furnature and private valuable possessions in large quantities, this was unsafe to move, have left 2x additional heads for client if these are found faulty as report specified at least 5.
PlumbingLuke Trevatt (03/10/2025) - Work NoteThe tap was found to be very loose on handle to cold tap to bath, fully tightened after checking integrity and fully run tested with no further isues.

Leaking tap/faucetLuke Trevatt (03/10/2025) - Work NoteAttended site and found retaining screw on cold tap of force bath shower mixer had come very loose, this meant the handle was just turning and not opening or closing cold valve internally, after removing and testing integrity of tap internal valve the handle was refitted and tightened appropriately, then fully tested with no leaks of control issues with opening flow and shutting of water.
David Collins (09/10/2025) - Work NoteCheck pump operation check for noises at different speed, check and vent pipe work order new pump.  job on going

David Collins (14/10/2025) - Work NoteCheck boiler house no faults found in, check plant room pumps and controls primary circuits cold trace fault to actuator . Remove actuator head and check flow and return getting hot. Check actuator to cylinder ok . job complete.
David Collins (22/10/2025) - Work NoteIsolate rad drain and remake joint on rad valves fill vent and check for leaks. job complete.
David Collins (28/10/2025) - Work NoteCheck pipe runs in roof space for roofing contractor. job complete

John Doidge (21/10/2025) - Work Note - 3 hours The immersion element is fitted to a commercial 400 litre indirect hot water cylinder. The live electrical connection to the plate that feeds each element has been snapped off. The immersion element will need to be replaced, requiring a full drain down of the cylinder. Site access is between 7 am and 3 pm, when facilities staff are on site.

Annual Service - Please collect keys from security as per Chris Webb. No attendance time given.John Doidge (02/10/2025) - Work NoteComplete the annual gas tightness test and service of the boiler.It was noted that the gas meter for this property is not fully supported. The gas meter is located in a storage area under flat 2, with access to the meter through a hatch in the external wall. There is a meter bracket fitted but this is not attached to anything. A framework of some sort would need to be manufactured. Further investigation would be needed.

Annual Service - Tenant will be home, no keys required. 1 x dog at property. AM visit advised between 08:30 - 12:00.John Doidge (02/10/2025) - Work NoteComplete the annual gas tightness test and boiler service.

Luke Trevatt (06/10/2025) - Work NoteAttended tap and found Ac system, with no power supply at controller tested condensing unit, no power supply from local rotary isolator after gaining access to isolator internally no supply power, on inspection it is clear that the R407C refrigerant has been leaking from liquid line flare, as oil staining on lagging and pipe along with refrigerant traces picked up on f-gas sniffer device. Recommend leak repair and further investigation into power supply.
Faulty heatingCasey Bonner (08/10/2025) - Work NoteReset timerprogrammerTop up pressureVent systemReplace trv

David Collins (08/10/2025) - Work NoteRemove boxing to get access to shower pump, disconnect hot and cold supply to pump remove air lock refit hot and cold and check pressure at showers. Replace boxing and report to dame .  job complete.

Attend and carry out full replacement of boiler controller and main pcb and enclosure. Luke Trevatt (14/10/2025) - Work NoteAttended site and carried out the replacement  Burderelus, GB402-620, control PCB AND ENCLOSURE.All works completed safely and fully commissioned, it has been noted that Burderus do recommend removal of air intake plate with the addition of a adaptor fitting to connect to top side of boiler, for balanced air flow, this has not been the case since original installed by main contractor. Leading to excessive swaleating within enclosure and multiple times electrical and pcb controls enclosures have been found saturated and board failures have happened.. I would recommend air intake enclosures are sourced and fitted with 90 degree bends and birds beak mesh grill attachments.
No heat or hot water Loose tapsCasey Bonner (13/10/2025) - Work NoteTighten tapsRepressurise system
David Collins (23/10/2025) - Work NoteTrace leak to shower only has a shower curtain so water runs on to floor, cap of shower head as IT were worried about servers underneath.job complete.

Shower no presure not workingLuke Trevatt (27/10/2025) - Work NoteAttended site and found that the pump located under bath suply boosted water to shower is intermittently failing, this has very poor access and would require the bath to be fully removed to gain access to replace pump, this will have to be arranged for 2 people to carry out works and then fully seal all bath surrounds, also the fuse spur located under bath requires replacing as this is not ip rated and could get water ingress in the event of a major leak, as this is located within zone 1,special precautions should be made, regarding rcd of this circuit along with correct ip rating. David Collins (28/10/2025) - Work NoteCheck location of shower pump and access , order new pump. job on going.

Heating issues.John Doidge (28/10/2025) - Work NoteSwitch on heating and adjust thermostat to create a heating demand. Wait for heating to circulate around the property. One radiator in the lounge and another on the first floor are not getting hot. Some radiators upstairs are too hot to touch. Adjust the lock-shield valve on these to improve the flow through the rest of the radiators. Both cold radiators are now getting heat circulating through them. Check all other radiators again to ensure all are still getting hot.

No heating/hot waterLuke Trevatt (29/10/2025) - Work NoteAttended site and found heating system very low on water pressure, Tested expansion vessel, then topped up systems water pressure and fully vented entire system of air pockets within multiple radiators, on first floor it appears the radiator lock shield valves on 2x rads have had very small weeps, these were tightness tested, all TRVS, regulating valves ideally require replacing long term as in very poor condition due to age, the circulating pump was tested along with 3 way valve and these operated well with no issues, the timer programmer was then set correctly and system fully run tested, with all radiators producing good thermal heat energy, and boiler operated very well,

Cold office, radiator not workingLuke Trevatt (29/10/2025) - Work NoteOn arrival I found that the boiler flow temp setting had been turned down to lowest set point, this when heating was on was not generating any heat at radiators on system and also hot water was only just Luke warm, I adjusted temperature set point of boiler to approx 65%, then carried out bleeding of radiators in areas reported as poor heat, these were full, with exception of the corridor radiator that was half empty, after 15 minutes all radiators were cosy and hot, the room thermostatic controller left at 21c and hw and ch controls times schedules checked, these are off all night and run during office hours, in auto mode. No further issues found.

Ac system in olimpics suit service required and making knocking noise. Luke Trevatt (28/10/2025) - Work NoteAttended site and carried out a full test and inspection of the 6x Ac fancoils serving the Olympic suit, there are 5x Aspen perrystaltic condensate pumps that are all working along with 1x Aspen orange silent max, that is showing signs of age related wear, this does work at present although, I would consider a replacement due to location of fancoil on sunny side of building, so in summer will be used hard, all systems produced good head discharge temps od 44/46degree c, one of the condensing units has had rodents living inside, this can cause isues with power or coms lines as they tend to chew cables, otherwise no isues to report.

Boiler plant room leakLuke Trevatt (28/10/2025) - Work NoteAttended site to header tank being over flown by return leg vent, this was due to after 1 week mag filter completely blocked and potential blockage within boiler heat exchanger, all area completely dried of 100ltrs of water in basement mag filter and return feed to boiler sucked clear, I would recommend system has a full power flush and new inhibitor, and will require a full venting at all rads again after, area currently all safe,

Fault with plant room boilerCasey Bonner (25/09/2025) - Work NoteFault with boiler no: 2  dried out P.C.B and tested but found that the P.C.B IS faulty  new P.C.BLuke Trevatt (25/09/2025) - Work NoteToday we have attended to theBLR02 CONDENSING BOILER Located within basement of Athens, This has been found to have sever water ingress across the main power /control Pcb and all plastic enclosure, all has been fully dried and after testing it has been found that display harness to controller attached and main PCB BOARDS are damaged and require immediate replacement, I would also recommend a plate is fitted where cables exit internal of boiler with ip rated glands, also enclosure for Pcb is raised on 4x sourcing map high density rubber blocks to allow a good air gap from boiler, also the air inlet on the 2 x boilers was found to be blanked close? These plates have been opened to allow better air circulation also to help complete combustion better, informed staff member that a new PCB will be ordered ASAP and that boiler is working.

data.descriptionText: RE: Water Heater Blow Down: 17/10/2025:  Dear Emily, Thank you for giving MEL Facilities Management the opportunity to provide you with our proposal to carry out the Water Heater Blow down and descale. Our scope of works will be as follows: Isolate the power and water supplyAllow the unit to cool downLocate the drain valve at the bottom of the tankAttach a hose and run into nearest drainOpen the drain valve to slowly allow the water to flow out of the tankSupply required chemical to clean the internal chambers of the water heater of sediment Once completed, close the drain valve and refill the water heaterEnsure Water heater reaches correct operating temperature and test water.We hope our proposal meets with your approval. We have allowed to undertake these works on a Friday when the building is quieter.

Could you please organise for someone to attend site at 3 Adlam Villas, 40 Greenham Road, Newbury, Berks, RG14 7HX. Could we please ask for you to investigate into why the fuse has blown to hot water cylinder. The hot water cylinder is in the loft space in the clinic room by the reception.  James Barnby (21/10/2025) - Work NoteInvestigated fault, found switched fused spur to have burnt out. After investigating I found the water heater to be pulling 12.5amp/3kw. With this being so close to the breaking capacity of the fuse and it being constantly on 24/7 I believe it has just got too hot over time and eventually burnt out. A replacement of a 16amp rotary isolator may be needed
